member.summary: The value is replaced by the open quote string from the quotes property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Declarations.ContentDeclaration.ContentValueConverter.CloseQuoteContentMode
member.summary: The value is replaced by the close string from the quotes property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Declarations.ContentDeclaration.ContentValueConverter.NoOpenQuoteContentMode
member.summary: Introduces no content, but increments the level of nesting for quotes.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Declarations.ContentDeclaration.ContentValueConverter.NoCloseQuoteContentMode
member.summary: Introduces no content, but decrements the level of nesting for quotes.

member.summary: The generated text is the value of all counters with the given name in scope at this pseudo-element, from outermost to innermost separated by the specified string.

member.summary: Returns the value of the element's attribute X as a string. If there is no attribute X, an empty string is returned.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationDirection
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible animation direction values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationDirection.Normal
member.summary: The animation should play forward each cycle. In other words, each time the animation cycles, the animation will reset to the beginning state and start over again. This is the default animation direction setting.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationDirection.Alternate
member.summary: The animation should reverse direction each cycle. When playing in reverse, the animation steps are performed backward. In addition, timing functions are also reversed; for example, an ease-in animation is replaced with an ease-out animation when played in reverse. The count to determine if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationDirection.Reverse
member.summary: The animation plays backward each cycle. Each time the animation cycles, the animation resets to the end state and start over again.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationDirection.AlternateReverse
member.summary: The animation plays backward on the first play-through, then forward on the next, then continues to alternate. The count to determinate if it is an even or an odd iteration starts at one.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationFillStyle
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible fill-mode values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationFillStyle.None
member.summary: The animation will not apply any styles to the target before or after it is executing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationFillStyle.Forwards
member.summary: The target will retain the computed values set by the last keyframe encountered during execution. The last keyframe encountered depends on the direction and the number of iterations.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationFillStyle.Backwards
member.summary: The animation will apply the values defined in the first relevant keyframe as soon as it is applied to the target, and retain this during the delayed period. The first relevant keyframe depends of the value of the direction.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.AnimationFillStyle.Both
member.summary: The animation will follow the rules for both forwards and backwards, thus extending the animation properties in both directions.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundAttachment
member.summary: An enumeration with all background attachment settings.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundAttachment.Fixed
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the viewport. Even if an element has a scrolling mechanism, a ‘fixed’ background doesn't move with the element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundAttachment.Local
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents, and the background painting area and background positioning area are relative to the scrollable area of the element rather than to the border framing them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundAttachment.Scroll
member.summary: This keyword means that the background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundRepeat
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible repeat values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundRepeat.Repeat
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover the whole background image painting area. The last image may be clipped if the whole thing won't fit in the remaining area.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundRepeat.Space
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover most of the background image painting area, without clipping an image. The remaining non-covered space is spaced out evenly between the images. The first and last images touches the edge of the element. The value of the background-position CSS property is ignored for the concerned direction, except if one single image is greater than the background image painting area, which is the only case where an image can be clipped when the space value is used.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundRepeat.Round
member.summary: The image is repeated in the given direction as much as needed to cover most of the background image painting area, without clipping an image. If it doesn't cover exactly the area, the tiles are resized in that direction in order to match it.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BackgroundRepeat.NoRepeat
member.summary: The image is not repeated (and hence the background image painting area will not necessarily been entirely covered). The position of the non-repeated background image is defined by the background-position CSS property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible blend-mode values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Normal
member.summary: Indicates that no blending will happen: the selected color is the one of the image on the top, and not the one of the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: Indicates that the blended color is the multiplication of the front color and the one of the background. Multiplication of colors always result in a color as dark as the original ones. To the limit, multiplying with black results in black, and multiplying with white results in the other original color.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Screen
member.summary: Simulates the simultaneous projection of the two images on a screen: the resulting color is always as light as the original ones. To the limit, multiplying with black results in the other original color, and multiplying with white results in white.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Overlay
member.summary: Acts as multiply or screen depending of the color of the background image for a given pixel. This is similar to hard-light but with the top and bottom color swapped.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects, for each pixel, the darkest color of the backdrop or the front image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects, for each pixel, the lightest color of the backdrop or the front image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.ColorDodge
member.summary: Lightens the backdrop according to the value of the foreground color: the brighter it is, the more its color affects the backdrop. White on the foreground image leads to white.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.ColorBurn
member.summary: Darkens the backdrop according to the value of the foreground color: the darker it is, the more its color affects the backdrop. Black on the foreground image leads to black.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.HardLight
member.summary: Acts as multiply or screen depending of the color of the foreground image for a given pixel. It reproduces an effect next to shining a harsh spotlight on the backdrop. This is similar to overlay but with the top and bottom color swapped.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.SoftLight
member.summary: Similar to hard-light and darkens or lightens the colors, depending of the foreground color. It leads to an effect next to shining a diffused spotlight on the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Difference
member.summary: Substracts the darker color to the lighter one. Black on the foreground has therefore no effect, white leads to the color of the backdrop, inverted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Exclusion
member.summary: Similar to difference but produce a result with less contrast. Like for difference, black on the foreground has no effect, while white leads to the color of the backdrop, inverted.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Hue
member.summary: Keeps the hue of the foreground color, while using the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Saturation
member.summary: Keeps the saturation of the foreground color, while using the hue and luminosity of the backdrop. A backdrop with no saturation, that is a pure grey, will lead to no change to the foreground image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Color
member.summary: Keeps the saturation and hue of the foreground color, while using the luminosity of the backdrop. This preserves gray levels and can be used to colorize the foreground image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BlendMode.Luminosity
member.summary: Keeps the luminosity of the foreground color, while using the saturation and hue of the backdrop.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BookmarkState
member.summary: The selected bookmark state.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BookmarkState.Open
member.summary: The bookmarks of the nearest descendants of an element with a bookmark-state of open will be displayed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BookmarkState.Closed
member.summary: Any bookmarks of descendant elements are not initially displayed.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BorderRepeat
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible border repeat values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BorderRepeat.Stretch
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be stretched to fill the gap between the two borders.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BorderRepeat.Repeat
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be repeated until it fills the gap between the two borders.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BorderRepeat.Round
member.summary: Keyword indicating that the image must be repeated until it fills the gap between the two borders. If the image doesn't fit after being repeated an integral number of times, the image is rescaled to fit.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BoxModel
member.summary: An enumeration with the various box sizing models / clip or origins.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BoxModel.BorderBox
member.summary: The background extends to the outside edge of the border (but underneath the border in z-ordering).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BoxModel.PaddingBox
member.summary: No background is drawn below the border (background extends to the outside edge of the padding).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BoxModel.ContentBox
member.summary: The background is painted within (clipped to) the content box.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode
member.summary: An enumeration over all possible break modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Auto
member.summary: Initial value. Allows, meaning neither forbid nor force, any break (either page, column or region) to be be inserted before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Always
member.summary: Always force page breaks before (after) the principle box. This is a synonym of page, it has been kept to facilitate transition from page-break-before which is subset of this property.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Avoid
member.summary: Prevent any break, either page, column or region, to be inserted right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Left
member.summary: Force one or two page breaks right before (after) the principle box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Right
member.summary: Force one or two page breaks right before (after) the principle box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Page
member.summary: Always force one page break right before (after) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.Column
member.summary: Always force one column break right before (after) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.AvoidPage
member.summary: Avoid any page break right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.AvoidColumn
member.summary: Avoid any column break right before (after, inside) the principle box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.BreakMode.AvoidRegion
member.summary: Avoid a region break before (after, inside) the generated box.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ClearMode
member.summary: The enumeration with all possible clear modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ClearMode.None
member.summary: The element is not moved down to clear past floating elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ClearMode.Left
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past left floats.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ClearMode.Right
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past right floats.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ClearMode.Both
member.summary: The element is moved down to clear past both left and right floats.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode
member.summary: A list of all pre-defined display settings.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.None
F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.Inline
member.summary: The element generates one or more inline element boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.Block
member.summary: The element generates a block element box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.ListItem
member.summary: The element generates a block box for the content and a separate list-item inline box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.InlineBlock
member.summary: The element generates a block element box that will be flowed with surrounding content as if it were a single inline box (behaving much like a replaced element would).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.InlineTable
member.summary: he inline-table value does not have a direct mapping in HTML. It behaves like a table HTML element, but as an inline box, rather than a block-level box. Inside the table box is a block-level context.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.Table
member.summary: Behaves like the table HTML element. It defines a block-level box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableCaption
member.summary: Behaves like the caption HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableCell
member.summary: Behaves like the td HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableColumn
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding col HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableColumnGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding colgroup HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableFooterGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding tfoot HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableHeaderGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding thead HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableRow
member.summary: Behaves like the tr HTML element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.TableRowGroup
member.summary: These elements behave like the corresponding tbody HTML elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.Flex
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.InlineFlex
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lays out its content according to the flexbox model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.Grid
member.summary: The element behaves like a block element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.DisplayMode.InlineGrid
member.summary: The element behaves like an inline element and lay out its content according to the grid model.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode
member.summary: Represents the modes for flex content, i.e., justify-content, align-content, and align-self.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determined.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.Start
member.summary: Follow the head.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.End
member.summary: Follow the tail.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.Center
member.summary: Follow the average.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.SpaceBetween
member.summary: Place space in between items.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.SpaceAround
member.summary: Fill with space around content.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretch to fill.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexContentMode.Baseline
member.summary: Follow the baseline.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexDirection
member.summary: Potential flex directions.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexDirection.Row
member.summary: Same direction as inline axis, i.e., from left to right.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexDirection.RowReverse
member.summary: Inverse direction as inine axis, i.e., from right to left.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexDirection.Column
member.summary: Same direction as block axis, i.e., from top to bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexDirection.ColumnReverse
member.summary: Inverse direction as block axis, i.e., from bottom to top.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexWrapMode
member.summary: Defines the values for flex wrapping.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexWrapMode.NoWrap
member.summary: No wrap is being done.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexWrapMode.Wrap
member.summary: Normal wrapping is enabled.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FlexWrapMode.WrapReverse
member.summary: Same as wrap with cross-start and cross-end swapped.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Floating
member.summary: All possible values for taking an element out of its normal flow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Floating.None
member.summary: Indicates that the element must not float.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Floating.Left
member.summary: Indicates that the element must float on the left side of its containing block.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Floating.Right
member.summary: Indicates that the element must float on the right side of its containing block.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Floating.Footnote
member.summary: Each footnote element is placed in the footnote area of the page.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.Normal
member.summary: Specifies a normal font face.

member.summary: Specifies a font face most condensed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.SemiCondensed
member.summary: Specifies a font face a little more condensed than normal.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.SemiExpanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face a little more expanded than normal.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.Expanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.ExtraExpanded
member.summary: Specifies a font face more expanded than normal.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStretch.UltraExpanded

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStyle
member.summary: The enumeration with the various font styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStyle.Normal
member.summary: Selects a font that is classified as normal within a font-family.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStyle.Italic
member.summary: Selects a font that is labeled italic, if that is not available, one labeled oblique.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontStyle.Oblique
member.summary: Selects a font that is labeled oblique.

member.summary: An enumeration with font variant transformations.

member.summary: Specifies a normal font face.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontVariant.SmallCaps
member.summary: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font.

member.summary: A listing of all possible pre-defined font-weights.

member.summary: Represents a fount weight of 400.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontWeight.Bold
member.summary: Represents a fount weight of 700.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontWeight.Bolder
member.summary: Makes the current font more bold (by 100).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FontWeight.Lighter
member.summary: Makes the current font less bold (by 100).

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnoteDisplay
member.summary: Represents the selected footnote display mode.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnoteDisplay.Block
member.summary: The footnote element is placed in the footnote area as a block element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnoteDisplay.Inline
member.summary: The footnote element is placed in the footnote area as an inline element.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnoteDisplay.Compact
member.summary: The user agent determines whether a given footnote element is placed as a block element or an inline element. If two or more footnotes could fit on the same line in the footnote area, they should be placed inline.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnotePolicy
member.summary: Represents the selected footnote policy.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnotePolicy.Auto
member.summary: The user agent chooses how to render footnotes, and may place the footnote body on a later page than the footnote reference. A footnote body must never be placed on a page before the footnote reference.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnotePolicy.Line
member.summary: If a given footnote body cannot be placed on the current page due to lack of space, the user agent introduces a forced page break at the start of the line containing the footnote reference, so that both the reference and the footnote body fall on the next page. Note that the user agent must honor widow and orphan settings when doing this, and so may need to insert the page break on an earlier line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.FootnotePolicy.Block
member.summary: As with line, except a forced page break is introduced before the paragraph that contains the footnote.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.HoverAbility
member.summary: Specifies a user's ability to hover over elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.HoverAbility.None
member.summary: Elements cannot be hovered at all.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.HoverAbility.OnDemand
member.summary: Possible, but requires a significant action on the user's part.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.HoverAbility.Hover
member.summary: Hover over parts of the page is easily possible.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible line styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.None
member.summary: No outline (outline-width is 0).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Hidden
member.summary: Same as 'none', except in terms of border conflict resolution for table elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Dotted
member.summary: The outline is a series of dots.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Dashed
member.summary: The outline is a series of short line segments.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Solid
member.summary: The outline is a single line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Double
member.summary: The outline is two single lines. The outline-width is the sum of the two lines and the space between them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Groove
member.summary: The outline looks as though it were carved into the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Ridge
member.summary: The opposite of groove: the outline looks as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Inset
member.summary: The outline makes the box look as though it were embeded in the canvas.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.LineStyle.Outset
member.summary: The opposite of inset: the outline makes the box look as though it were coming out of the canvas.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting
member.summary: The enumeration over all possible object fitting values.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting.None
member.summary: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box: determine the object's concrete object size using the default sizing algorithm with no specified size, and a default object size equal to the replaced element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting.Fill
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to fill the element's content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting.Contain
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element's content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting.Cover
member.summary: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element's used width and height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ObjectFitting.ScaleDown
member.summary: Size the content as if none or contain were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode
member.summary: An enumeration with possible overflow modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode.Auto
member.summary: The overflow-mode is determined by the renderer.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode.Visible
member.summary: The content is allowed to overflow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode.Hidden
member.summary: The content is cut to prevent overflowing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode.Scroll
member.summary: The content can be scrolled.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowMode.Clip
member.summary: The content must be directionally clipped. This only applies to overflow-x or overflow-y.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowWrap
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible Overflow Wrap options.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowWrap.Normal
member.summary: Indicates that lines may only break at normal word break points.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.OverflowWrap.BreakWord
member.summary: Indicates that normally unbreakable words may be broken at arbitrary points if there are no otherwise acceptable break points in the line.

member.summary: An enumeration over all various play states.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PlayState.Running
member.summary: The animation is currently playing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PlayState.Paused
member.summary: The animation is currently paused.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerAccuracy
member.summary: Values for the accuracy of a pointer device.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerAccuracy.None
member.summary: Not actually a pointing device.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerAccuracy.Coarse
member.summary: Defines a pointing device of limited accuracy.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerAccuracy.Fine
member.summary: Defines an accurate pointing device.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent
member.summary: The values for pointer-event.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.None
member.summary: The element is never the target of pointer events; however, pointer events may target its descendant elements if those descendants have pointer-events set to some other value. In these circumstances, pointer events will trigger event listeners on this parent element as appropriate on their way to/from the descendant during the event capture/bubble phases.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.Auto
member.summary: The element behaves as it would if the pointer-events property were not specified. In SVG content, this value and the value visiblePainted have the same effect.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.VisiblePainted
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the visibility property is set to visible and e.g. when a mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., 'fill') of the element and the fill property is set to a value other than none, or when a mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., 'stroke') of the element and the stroke property is set to a value other than none.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.VisibleFill
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the visibility property is set to visible and when e.g. a mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., fill) of the element. The value of the fill property does not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.VisibleStroke
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the visibility property is set to visible and e.g. when the mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The value of the stroke property does not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.Visible
member.summary: SVG only. The element can be the target of a pointer event when the visibility property is set to visible and e.g. the mouse cursor is over either the interior (i.e., fill) or the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the fill and stroke do not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.Painted
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when e.g. the mouse cursor is over the interior (i.e., 'fill') of the element and the fill property is set to a value other than none, or when the mouse cursor is over the perimeter (i.e., 'stroke') of the element and the stroke property is set to a value other than none. The value of the visibility property does not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.Fill
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the pointer is over the interior (i.e., fill) of the element. The values of the fill and visibility properties do not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.Stroke
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the pointer is over the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the stroke and visibility properties do not affect event processing.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.PointerEvent.All
member.summary: SVG only. The element can only be the target of a pointer event when the pointer is over the interior (i.e., fill) or the perimeter (i.e., stroke) of the element. The values of the fill, stroke, and visibility properties do not affect event processing.

member.name: M:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.StyleDeclarationExtensions.SetTransitionProperty(AngleSharp.Css.Dom.ICssStyleDeclaration,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a value that identifies the CSS property name or names to which the transition effect (defined by the transition-duration, transition-timing-function, and transition-delay properties) is applied when a new property value is specified.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor
member.summary: A list of all pre-defined system cursor modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Auto
member.summary: Automatically determined.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Default
member.summary: Default cursor, typically an arrow.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.None
member.summary: No cursor is rendered.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.ContextMenu
member.summary: A context menu is available under the cursor.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Help
member.summary: Indicating help is available.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Pointer
member.summary: E.g. used when hovering over links, typically a hand.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Progress
member.summary: The program is busy in the background but the user can still interact with the interface (unlike for wait).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Wait
member.summary: The program is busy (sometimes an hourglass or a watch).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Cell
member.summary: Indicating that cells can be selected.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Crosshair
member.summary: Cross cursor, often used to indicate selection in a bitmap.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Text
member.summary: Indicating text can be selected, typically an I-beam.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.VerticalText
member.summary: Indicating that vertical text can be selected, typically a sideways I-beam.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Alias
member.summary: Indicating an alias or shortcut is to be created.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Copy
member.summary: Indicating that something can be copied.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Move
member.summary: The hovered object may be moved.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NoDrop
member.summary: Cursor showing that a drop is not allowed at the current location.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NotAllowed
member.summary: Cursor showing that something cannot be done.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.EResize
member.summary: Moves the right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NResize
member.summary: Moves the top edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NeResize
member.summary: Moves the top right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NwResize
member.summary: Moves the top left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.SResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.SeResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom right edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.SwResize
member.summary: Moves the bottom left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.WResize
member.summary: Moves the left edge.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.EwResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Left to right.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NsResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Top to bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NeswResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Right top to left bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.NwseResize
member.summary: Indicates a bidirectional resize cursor. Left top to right bottom.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.ColResize
member.summary: The item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.RowResize
member.summary: The item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.AllScroll
member.summary: Cursor showing that something can be scrolled in any direction (panned).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.ZoomIn
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.ZoomOut
member.summary: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Grab
member.summary: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemCursor.Grabbing
member.summary: Indicates that something can be dragged to be moved.

member.summary: The font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemFont.Icon
member.summary: The font used to label icons.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemFont.Menu
member.summary: The font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemFont.MessageBox
member.summary: The font used in dialog boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemFont.SmallCaption
member.summary: The font used for labeling small controls.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.SystemFont.StatusBar
member.summary: The font used in window status bars.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible text last alignments.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Auto
member.summary: The affected line is aligned per the value of text-align, unless text-align is justify, in which case the effect is the same as etting text-align-last to left.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Start
member.summary: The same as left if direction is left-to-right and right if direction is right-to-left.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.End
member.summary: The same as right if direction is left-to-right and left if direction is right-to-left.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Left
member.summary: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Right
member.summary: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Center
member.summary: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAlignLast.Justify
member.summary: The text is justified. Text should line up their left and right edges to the left and right content edges of the paragraph.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAnchor
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible text anchors.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAnchor.Start
member.summary: The rendered characters are aligned such that the start of the text string is at the initial current text position

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAnchor.Middle
member.summary: The rendered characters are aligned such that the middle of the text string is at the current text position.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextAnchor.End
member.summary: The rendered characters are aligned such that the end of the text string is at the initial current text position.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationLine
member.summary: An enumeration that defines the various line styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationLine.Underline
member.summary: Each line of text is underlined.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationLine.Overline
member.summary: Each line of text has a line above it.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationLine.LineThrough
member.summary: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationLine.Blink
member.summary: The text blinks (alternates between visible and invisible). Conforming user agents may simply not blink the text.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle
member.summary: An enumeration with the various text decoration styles.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle.Solid
member.summary: Draws a single line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle.Double
member.summary: Draws a double line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle.Dotted
member.summary: Draws a dotted line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle.Dashed
member.summary: Draws a dashed line.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextDecorationStyle.Wavy
member.summary: Draws a wavy line.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible text justification options.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.Auto
member.summary: The browser determines the justification algorithm

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.InterWord
member.summary: Increases/Decreases the space between words

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.InterIdeograph
member.summary: Justifies content with ideographic text

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.InterCluster
member.summary: Only content that does not contain any inter-word spacing (such as Asian languages) is justified

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.Distribute
member.summary: Handles spacing much like the newspaper value. This form of justification is optimized for documents in Asian languages, such as Thai.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.DistributeAllLines
member.summary: Justifies lines of text in the same way as the distribute value, except that it also justifies the last line of the paragraph

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.DistributeCenterLast
member.summary: Not implemented

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.Kashida
member.summary: Justifies content by elongating characters

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextJustify.Newspaper
member.summary: Increases or decreases the spacing between letters and between words. It is the most sophisticated form of justification for Latin alphabets.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform
member.summary: An enumeration with all possible text transformations.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform.None
member.summary: Is a keyword preventing the case of all characters to be changed.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform.Capitalize
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the first letter of each word to be converted to uppercase. Other characters are unchanged; that is, they retain their original case as written in the element's text.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform.Uppercase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to uppercase.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform.Lowercase
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing all characters to be converted to lowercase.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.TextTransform.FullWidth
member.summary: Is a keyword forcing the writing of a character, mainly ideograms and latin scripts inside a square, allowing them to be aligned in the usual East Asian scripts (like Chinese or Japanese).

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode
member.summary: An enumeration with various unicode modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.Normal
member.summary: The element does not offer a additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline elements implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.Embed
member.summary: If the element is inline, this value opens an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. The direction of this embedding level is given by the direction property.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.Isolate
member.summary: This keyword indicates that the element's container directionality should be calculated without considering the content of this element. The element is therefore isolated from its siblings. When applying its bidirectional-resolution algorithm, its container element treats it as one or several U+FFFC Object Replacement Character, i.e. like an image.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.BidiOverride
member.summary: For inline elements this creates an override. For block container elements this creates an override for inline-level descendants not within another block container element. This means that inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the direction property; the implicit part of the bidirectional algorithm is ignored.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.IsolateOverride
member.summary: This keyword applies the isolation behavior of the isolate keyword to the surrounding content and the override behavior of the bidi-override keyword to the inner content.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UnicodeMode.Plaintext
member.summary: This keyword makes the elements directionality calculated without considering its parent bidirectional state or the value of the direction property.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UpdateFrequency
member.summary: Available device update frequencies.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UpdateFrequency.None
member.summary: Once it has been rendered, the layout can no longer be updated. Example: documents printed on paper.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UpdateFrequency.Slow
member.summary: The layout may change dynamically according to the usual rules of CSS, but the output device is not able to render or display changes quickly enough for them to be percieved as a smooth animation. Example: E-ink screens or severely under-powered devices.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.UpdateFrequency.Normal
member.summary: The layout may change dynamically according to the usual rules of CSS, and the output device is not unusually constrained in speed, so regularly-updating things like CSS Animations can be used. Example: computer screens.

member.name: T:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace
member.summary: An enumeration with the various whitespace handling modes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace.Normal
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Newline characters in the source are handled as other whitespace. Breaks lines as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace.Pre
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved, lines are only broken at newline characters in the source and at br elements.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace.NoWrap
member.summary: Collapses whitespace as for normal, but suppresses line breaks (text wrapping) within text.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace.PreWrap
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are preserved. Lines are broken at newline characters, at br, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Dom.Whitespace.PreLine
member.summary: Sequences of whitespace are collapsed. Lines are broken at newline characters, at br, and as necessary to fill line boxes.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Values.Length.Unit.Vh
member.summary: The value is relative to the viewport height. 1vh = 1/100 of the viewport height.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Values.Length.Unit.Vmin
member.summary: The value is relative to the minimum of viewport width and height. 1vmin = 1/100 of the minimum viewport dimension.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Values.Length.Unit.Vmax
member.summary: The value is relative to the maximum of viewport width and height. 1vmax = 1/100 of the maximum viewport dimension.

member.name: F:AngleSharp.Css.Values.Length.Unit.Percent
member.summary: The value is relative to a fixed (external) value, that is context dependent. 1% = 1/100 of the external value.
